message.content:
<<<api>>>: javax.imageio.ImageIO
<<<code>>>: 
public static void getScreenShot(BufferedImage capture, Path folder, String filename, float quality) {
    try {
        ImageWriter writer = ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpeg").next();
        ImageWriteParam param = writer.getDefaultWriteParam();
        param.setCompressionMode(ImageWriteParam.MODE_EXPLICIT);
        param.setCompressionQuality(quality);
        File file = new File(folder.toString()+"/"+filename+".jpg");
        FileImageOutputStream output = new FileImageOutputStream(file);
        writer.setOutput(output);
        IIOImage iioImage = new IIOImage(capture, null, null);
        writer.write(null, iioImage, param);
    } catch (IOException ex) {
        Logger.getLogger(ScreenShotMaker.class.getName()).log(Level.SEVERE, null, ex);
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In order to set the compression level of the jpeg file, you need to get an ImageWriter for the "jpeg" format using ImageIO.getImageWritersByFormatName("jpeg").next(). Then, you can get the default ImageWriteParam from the writer and set the compression mode to MODE_EXPLICIT. After that, you can set the compression quality using param.setCompressionQuality(quality), where quality is a float between 0 and 1. Finally, you can write the image using the writer.write(null, iioImage, param) method.
